results.definition: move obliquely or sideways, usually in an uncontrolled manner
examples: the wheels skidded against the sidewalk

results.definition: a restraint provided when the brake linings are moved hydraulically against the brake drum to retard the wheel's rotation
apply a brake or skid to
one of a pair of planks used to make a track for rolling or sliding objects

examples: the car skidded in the curve on the wet road
